pullRequest.body:
We prove Dirichlet's unit theorem. More precisely, the main results are:
```lean
def basisModTorsion : Basis (Fin (Units.rank K)) ‚Ñ§ (Additive ((ùìû K)À£ ‚ß∏ (torsion K)))
```
where `Units.rank := Fintype.card (InfinitePlace K) - 1` and 
```lean 
theorem exist_unique_eq_mul_prod (x : (ùìû K)À£) : ‚àÉ! (Œ∂ : torsion K) (e : Fin (Units.rank K) ‚Üí ‚Ñ§),
    x = Œ∂ * ‚àè i, (fundSystem K i) ^ (e i)
```
 where `fundSystem : Fin (rank K) ‚Üí (ùìû K)À£` is a fundamental system of units. 

The exponents in `exist_unique_eq_mul_prod` can be computed via the following result:
```lean
theorem fun_eq_repr {x Œ∂ : (ùìû K)À£} {f : Fin (rank K) ‚Üí ‚Ñ§} (hŒ∂ : Œ∂ ‚àà torsion K) 
    (h : x = Œ∂ * ‚àè i, (fundSystem K i) ^ (f i)) : f = (basisModTorsion K).repr (Additive.ofMul ‚Üëx)
```

---

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go

-->

* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#5748~~

<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->
This is a really nice milestone! It's been quite a journey, but now all the prerequisites are in you're really on the home straight!

> This is a really nice milestone! It's been quite a journey, but now all the prerequisites are in you're really on the home straight!

Thanks! It was a very interesting project to work on. And now I have to find something new to work on ;)

One final comment: we can add
```lean
instance : Module.Finite ‚Ñ§ (Additive (ùìû K)À£)
```
but I don't know if it is easy with current mathlib or it's better to wait for another PR. In any case thanks a lot!!

bors d+

:v: xroblot can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

> One final comment: we can add
> 
> ```lean
> instance : Module.Finite ‚Ñ§ (Additive (ùìû K)À£)
> ```
> 
> but I don't know if it is easy with current mathlib or it's better to wait for another PR. In any case thanks a lot!!

It is not so difficult to prove but there is some API missing for things like `Additive` or `AddMonoidHom.toIntLinearMap`. I think it will have to wait for another PR (coming soon ;)
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/6327152320/job/17182344346)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/6327152320/job/17182345095)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/6327152320/job/17182344747)

There are 21 `Finset.` in the file, opening `Finset` at the beginning allows to get rid of `20` of them and it seems a good idea.

In any case great work, thanks a lot!

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion ¬∑ exact fun w _ => pow_le_pow_of_le_left (by positivity) (le_of_lt (h_yle w)) (mult w) ```

```suggestion
theorem sum_logEmbedding_component (x : (ùìû K)À£) :
```

Should this maybe even be
```suggestion
namespace dirichletUnitTheorem
```
because I can imagine several topics that could go in the `dirichlet` namespace.

I assume most results in this namespace will be quite specific to the proof. If someone finds a use for one of the results more generally, that is in indication that it should be moved out of this namespace to a different place.

```suggestion
-- To prove that the span over `‚Ñù` of the `unitLattice` is equal to the full space, we construct
```

```suggestion
/-- Construct a unit associated to the place `w‚ÇÅ`. The family, for `w‚ÇÅ ‚â† w‚ÇÄ`, formed by the
```
Should this maybe be a simp-lemma?
Shouldn't these both be instances?
I have made instances of the results that say that the `unitLattice` is discrete, a free module and a finite module but still give names to the instances (in the `NumberField.Units` namespace).

The three results above should be outside the namespace, I think. They are main outcomes of all the work above, and they are also results that will be used in applications of this file, just like the results below.
Actually, all these results are in the `NumberField` namespace, right? I think it's best to prepend this to the names, even if that makes them a bit long. Because then docgen will linkify them.
Ok. I also fixed a prefix missing and changed the docstring to mention explicitly "Dirichlet Unit Theorem".
If you close this namespace before stating the above results, then you don't need to do the `_root_` dance in their names.
Yes, I moved this to a new section. I also added a docstring for the function `fun_eq_repr `. I am not really sure about the name of this function or if the new docstring is clear enough...

```suggestion
* `NumberField.Units.mem_torsion`: a unit `x : (ùìû K)À£` is torsion iff `w x = 1` for all infinite
places `w` of `K`.
```

```suggestion
theorem rootsOfUnity_eq_one [NumberField K] {k : ‚Ñï+} (hc : Nat.Coprime k (torsionOrder K))
```

```suggestion
-- This section is devoted to the proof of Dirichlet's unit theorem
-- We define a group morphism from `(ùìû K)À£` to `{w : InfinitePlace K // w ‚â† w‚ÇÄ} ‚Üí ‚Ñù` where `w‚ÇÄ`
-- is a distinguished (arbitrary) infinite place, prove that its kernel is the torsion subgroup
-- (see `logEmbedding_eq_zero_iff`) and that its image, called `unitLattice`, is a full
-- `‚Ñ§`-lattice. It follows that `unitLattice` is a free `‚Ñ§`-module (see `unitLattice_moduleFree `) of
-- rank `card (InfinitePlaces K) - 1` (see `unitLattice_rank`).
-- To prove that the `unitLattice` is a full `‚Ñ§`-lattice, we need to prove that it is discrete
-- (see `unitLattice_inter_ball_finite`) and that it spans the full space over `‚Ñù`
-- (see ` unitLattice_span_eq_top`); this is the main part of the proof, see the section
-- `span_top` below for more details.
```
You can maybe write something like 
```
### Dirichlet Unit Theorem
This section is devoted to the proof of Dirichlet's unit theorem...
```
I think the explanation deserves to be visible in the doc.
I made this explanation and the next one invisible in the doc (well, I hope I did it properly).

```suggestion
    simp_rw [fun_eq_repr K Œ∑.prop hf] at hf
```

`w‚ÇÄ` is just some random (fixed) infinite place, right? I mean it has nothing "distinguished". If I remember correctly your talk in Lyon last year, there is a mathematically interesting point here (related to the fact that there is at least one infinite place), maybe you can mention it (it's very possible I misremember, in this case just ignore the comment).

I do not remember anything special about that if only that there was the need to prove the instance that `InfinitePlace` was not empty...

The name `distinguished` here just mean that it plays from now on a special role compared to the other infinite place. Maybe, there is a better name for that.

This can be called `logEmbedding_apply` (but I am not sure). I tried to auto generate it using `simps`, but unfortunately it produces a syntactically different lemma (even if it is definitionally the same).
I'd rather keep the name as it is even though I agree it is not great since, for me, in this context `apply` means applying a function to its argument and that would not be the case here.
If you change the name above also this should be changed.

```suggestion
  ¬∑ linarith [(map_nonneg _ _ : 0 ‚â§ w x)]
```

```suggestion
theorem logEmbedding_eq_zero_iff {x : (ùìû K)À£} :
```
Just because in the above iff lemmas the variable was implicit.

```suggestion
    ¬∑ suffices -mult w‚ÇÄ * Real.log (w‚ÇÄ (x : K)) = 0 by
```
More readable I think.

```suggestion
  ¬∑ suffices {x : (ùìû K)À£ | IsIntegral ‚Ñ§ (x : K) ‚àß
        ‚àÄ (œÜ : K ‚Üí+* ‚ÑÇ), ‚ÄñœÜ x‚Äñ ‚â§ Real.exp ((Fintype.card (InfinitePlace K)) * r)}.Finite by
```

```suggestion
-- To prove that the span over `‚Ñù` of the `unitLattice` is equal to the full space, we construct
-- for each infinite place `w‚ÇÅ ‚â† w‚ÇÄ` a unit `u_w‚ÇÅ` of `K` such that, for all infinite places
-- `w` such that `w ‚â† w‚ÇÅ`, we have `Real.log w (u_w‚ÇÅ) < 0` (and thus `Real.log w‚ÇÅ (u_w‚ÇÅ) > 0`).
-- It follows then from a determinant computation (using `Matrix.det_ne_zero_of_neg`) that the
-- image by `logEmbedding` of these units is a `‚Ñù`-linearly independent family.
-- The unit `u_w‚ÇÅ` is obtained by constructing a sequence `seq n` of nonzero algebraic integers
-- that is strictly decreasing at infinite places distinct from `w‚ÇÅ` and of norm `‚â§ B`. Since
-- there are finitely many ideals of norm `‚â§ B`, there exists two term in the sequence defining
-- the same ideal and their quotient is the desired unit `u_w‚ÇÅ` (see `exists_unit`).
```
Again you can make this visible in the doc.

Since we have [Antitone](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Order/Monotone/Basic.html#Antitone) this name should probably be changed (or the statement modified to use `Antitone`, but this seems annoying). Also, is there a reason why you use `‚àÄ w ...` instead of the more common `{w : ...} (hw : ...)`?
No real good reason. I changed it.
We usually state two separate results rather than using `‚àß`.
I split it into two lemmas.

```suggestion
    ‚àÉ u : (ùìû K)À£, ‚àÄ w : InfinitePlace K, w ‚â† w‚ÇÅ ‚Üí Real.log (w u) < 0 := by
```

Here you are just proving that the module is free of the given rank, right? I mean, the basis has nothing special (except that it exists!). We usually don't construct data in tactic mode since it's harder to control what happens.

Here it seems better to show that it is free and compute the rank (in practice what you did), and then use `chooseBasis` if you need a fixed basis.

Riccardo, thanks a lot for the extensive review! I hope I addressed your concerns properly. 

Now, concerning this last point, I have split the results of this proof into three different results:
```lean
instance : Module.Free ‚Ñ§ (Additive ((ùìû K)À£ ‚ß∏ (torsion K))) := ...

instance : Module.Finite ‚Ñ§ (Additive ((ùìû K)À£ ‚ß∏ (torsion K))) := ...

theorem rank_modTorsion :
    FiniteDimensional.finrank ‚Ñ§ (Additive ((ùìû K)À£ ‚ß∏ (torsion K))) = rank K := ...
```
Still, I kept the definition of `basisModTorsion` since I need it to define `fundSystem` so that I can state 
```lean
theorem exist_unique_eq_mul_prod (x : (ùìû K)À£) : ‚àÉ! (Œ∂ : torsion K) (e : Fin (rank K) ‚Üí ‚Ñ§),
    x = Œ∂ * ‚àè i, (fundSystem K i) ^ (e i) 
```
which is, for me, the classical way to state Dirichlet's unit theorem. Even though, morally, it is contained in the three statements given above...
Yes, this is what I meant. I think it makes clearer that `basisModTorsion` is just a random basis.

```suggestion
### Section `span_top`
```
Not 100% sure...
Actually, I think I want `#### Section span_top` so that it looks like a subsection of `### Dirichlet Unit Theorem` if my understanding of the existing code is correct.
I have no idea if the number of `#` is unlimited, but we can try and at worst change this in a small PR later.

```suggestion
def basisModTorsion : Basis (Fin (rank K)) ‚Ñ§ (Additive ((ùìû K)À£ ‚ß∏ (torsion K))) :=
  Basis.reindex (Module.Free.chooseBasis ‚Ñ§ _) (Fintype.equivOfCardEq <| by
    rw [‚Üê FiniteDimensional.finrank_eq_card_chooseBasisIndex, rank_modTorsion, Fintype.card_fin])
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(NumberTheory.NumberField.Units): proof of Dirichlet's unit theorem
